text: General elections were held in the Northern Mariana Islands on 3 November 2007, alongside a double referendum.Calendar of Events Commonwealth Electoral Commission The Republican Party won a majority of seats in the House of Representatives, whilst both referendums were approved. ==Background== The two referendums were on proposed amendments to the constitution. One would amend Chapter XV, article 2, section a to establish a new Higher Education Commission to license post-secondary educational institutions.Northern Mariana Islands, 3 November 2007: Higher education under a separate Commission Direct Democracy The other would amend the Chapter III, article 4 to require a second round in the elections for governor and lieutenant governor if no candidate received over 50% in the first round.Northern Mariana Islands, 3 November 2007: Second round of gubernatorial elections Direct Democracy ==Results== ===Legislature=== ====Senate==== {| class=wikitable
